single_nested.description: Advanced analysis options. Each can be set independently.

string.description: How to aggregate data values in the report.
The start timestamp of the time range in RFC3339 format.
The end timestamp of the time range in RFC3339 format.

single_nested.description: Required when the time range is set to "custom".

bool.description: Set to `true` to exclude the values.

list_nested.description: The filters to apply to the report.

string.description:
For basic metrics, the value can be one of: ["cost", "usage", "savings"]
If using custom metrics, the value must refer to an existing custom ID.

single_nested.description: Metric selector used in reports and filters.

int64.description: The number of items to show

single_nested.description: To limit the number of results based on ranking. See [Limit by top/bottom](https://help.doit.com/docs/cloud-analytics/reports/editing-your-cloud-report#limit-by-topbottom).

list_nested.description: The rows that appear in the tabular format of the report. See [Group by](https://help.doit.com/docs/cloud-analytics/reports/editing-your-cloud-report#group-by).

bool.description:
Whether to include [promotional credits](https://help.doit.com/docs/cloud-analytics/reports/editing-your-cloud-report#promotional-credits).
If set to **true**, the report must use time interval `month`, `quarter`, or `year`.
Whether to include subgroup totals in the report. This option has no impact when reading a report via API.

string.description: Type of visualization or output format.

For basic metrics, the value can be one of: ["cost", "usage", "savings"]
If using custom metrics, the value must refer to an existing custom ID.

single_nested.description: Metric selector used in reports and filters.

string.description:
For basic metrics, the value can be one of: ["cost", "usage", "savings"]
If using custom metrics, the value must refer to an existing custom ID.

single_nested.description: Metric selector used in reports and filters.

string.description: Comparison operator for filtering metric values.

single_nested.description: Metric filter to limit report rows by metric value.

string.description: This option has no impact when reading reports via API.
This option has no impact when reading reports via API.
ID of the field to split.

bool.description: Indicate whether to include the origin.

string.description:
Type of the origin.
The only supported values at the moment: "attribution", "unallocated"

Type of the target.
The only supported value at the moment: "attribution"

float64.description: Percent of the target, represented in float format. E.g. 30% is 0.3. Required only if the Split Mode is custom.

string.description:
Type of the split.
The only supported value at the moment: "attribution_group"

list_nested.description: The splits to use in the report.

string.description: Time interval for grouping data in the report.

int64.description: Number of time units to include in the time range.

bool.description: Whether to include the current time period.

string.description: Time range mode (last N periods, current period, or custom).
Time unit for the time range.

single_nested.description:
Specify a predefined or custom time range for the report.
For example, to specify a custom time range of "last 2 days", set the mode to `last`, the amount to `2`, and the unit to `day`. If `includeCurrent` is `true`, the range will be yesterday and today; otherwise, the range will be yesterday and the day before yesterday.
If "custom" type is specified, you need to provide a custom time range in the `customTimeRange` field.
